author: Avinash Patidar
comment: GPS not works properly.

author: ramesh chandra
comment: Fantastic Running Tracker, Great Motivator To Run But GPS has some problem

author: Lindsay Pulsipher
comment: I miss Adidas train and run! Bring it back!

author: lena kadriu
comment: Love it. Using it for many years now
I put the distance  An wake

author: Sanjay Adkar
comment: Add MI BAND support

author: Thapelo Dipela
comment: Awesome even better than most paid for apps

author: Esaiah Hez
comment: Just awesome for a free application.
Great App

author: Jordan Applegate
comment: This app does not successfully use the GPS on my Moto G3. Google maps works. Why not this app? GPS is the main feature, so it needs to be perfect. I live in flat Tampa FL, and there is yet to be a time when the app tracks my position for at least 10 seconds.

reply.author: Runtastic
reply.content: Hey there, have you already submitted your problem to our Support Team? If not, please submit a ticket to us at help.runtastic.com. We look forward to helping you resolve this issue. Thank you and have a great day, Your Runtastic Team.

author: Kelsey Binggeli-Mullaly
comment: I'm soooo incredibly disappointed with this app. I had been using it for a few months until it slowly started freezing every 3rd run or so, then just got worse. It finally stopped working 90% of the time. Junk. I switched to Endomondo and am much happier!

author: Angie Wagner
comment: Only thing is it doesn't recognize Pandora as a music source to play through the app (it used to). But other than that, it tracks your progress well, GPS feature is great, the voice commands are helpful and easy to adjust to your liking, and the stories to run to are awesome. My favorite features are the goals and the live tracking. My goal is to run 450 miles this year and with each run it tells me how close I am to achieving it. And the live tracking through Facebook allows people to watch your progress. It may sound bad to some introverts, but when people "like" the post on facebook while you're running, it comes over your headphones in real time as a cheer. So people actively cheer you on while you're running! It helps to motivate me. If I'm slowing down and someone cheers me on, I get a burst of energy and speed up. It pushes me to go harder and I love it. All in all an incredible app!

author: Peter Jones
comment: Increasingly unreliable : keeps crashing or freezing in use. Please fix. I don't need "extra features" when I'm out on a run. I need reliability...

reply.author: Runtastic
reply.content: Hello, we are very sorry. Please contact our Support Team at help.runtastic.com so we can take a closer look at the problem you're experiencing. We appreciate your valuable feedback and look forward to finding a solution for you.

author: Camilo Arturo López
comment: It's a great up, very useful to track progress and analyze your performance after a run. On the improvement side, sometimes have small disconnections of the GPS, and/or is not convenient to stream music at the same time due to use of internet connection. It is also a bit pushy with Facebook sharing but probably some people like that.

author: Karl Beutner
comment: Runtastic is the only long-distance training program I have found that does not include a strength training component. While my Runtastic purchase includes access to Runtastic Results - which is full  of great strength training exercises and plans - there is zero integration between the strength plans and the running plans in the two apps!   I tried doing a half marathon training plan in Runtastic in parallel with a 3 workouts per week (the minimum number of workouts possible) in Runtastic Results. To stay current on each plan I need to work out almost every day. After 21 straight days of running or strength exercises without a rest day, I finally hit the wall.  While the individual apps are excellent, I am very disappointed that there is not better integration between the training plans. Even the Runtastic blog goes on-and-on about how important it is to include strength training in your running plan! This disappointment is amplified by the fact that both Nike Run Club, and Garmin Connect have free and excellent integration between the running and strength apps! Why did I waste my money on this app when I could have had a more integrated training app for free?

author: Peng Shu
comment: After recent update, this app became  terrible.  I'm looking for substitute now. Nothing is more frustrated than this- you are standing behind the start line, finally get everything (including your breath) ready and click the start button... and find out there is ad popped up for you to dismiss . Yes.  I may need to buy the pro version, but before doing that, I believe I can find  a better one.

reply.author: Runtastic
reply.content: We're here to serve you & assure you that we don't display ads in our paid products. However, in free products, we do display ads from selected partners as a way to support our business. If you'd prefer an ad-free experience, consider trying Runtastic PRO or becoming a Runtastic Premium Member. We'd love to welcome you to the club!

author: Korey Yost
comment: I do not use the pro version but the features are perfect enough for me to track and train for my races with decent accuracy. Very few moments when bugs or sudden closure of the app has occurred.

author: Marquez88
comment: This is not even close to Adidas Train&Run. Please import training plans from Adidas. These plans are poor. It's too much distance oriented. Nothing for fitness, getting lean, loosing weight... I tried all apps, Adidas was untouchable. Make that to Runtastic.

author: Alan Elger
comment: Better than the other few popular running apps I checked out. More access to things without paying and a slightly more reasonable subscription fee for premium.

author: Amy Stinnett
comment: I've been using this app for several years now, and I love it. If data is your thing, you'll love it too. My favorite features are the shoe tracker (you'll never have to guess again about when to retire your shoes!), the yearly goals, and water loss after each activity (hydration is life!). Also, you can pair this app with MyFitnessPal, which is great for making sure your calorie intake is on point.

author: François Auerbach
comment: Four to five clicks to finish your workout! Runtastic is needy as hell.  Training plans are a good feature but don't let you choose the days you'll run. Tough luck if you want Sunday off and run on Monday: you can't!  Live coaching is not very useful and not customisable in any meaningful way.  Runtastic is insecure; doesn't sync with other running apps, so you're locked in by default.  The coloured zones have nothing to do with your actual pace or heart rates, so do with them what you want.  Many of us have been sold to Runtastic by Adidas when they retired micoach but this app is very inferior in many ways, and even annoying at times.

author: Kunal Jain
comment: Thought this is best app for running, but it failed. I was standing at same place and testing the app by starting it. When timer started what I saw was calorie meter also started to increase. If I wasn't running than how the hell my calories burnt. I have snapshot with me but no option to attach here. Note: I checked this for over a minute.

reply.author: Runtastic
reply.content: Hey there, have you already submitted your problem to our Support Team? If not, please submit a ticket to us at help.runtastic.com. We look forward to helping you resolve this issue.

author: Gurumayum Bidyasagar Sharma
comment: Tracking your improvement has never been this easier. And a whole.lot of other Runtastic apps combined together makes this the best app in store. Thanks to all the team.

author: gautam varadarajan
comment: The live tracking doesn't start sometimes by stating that gps signal is weak even though I can see my position clearly moving on Google maps. Need to improve tracking capabilities.

author: yuvraj singh
comment: i started this app to check the precision and realised that it shows fake calorie burn even without doing any workout of even without moving an inch forward. i don't know what is wrong with the application.

author: Bill Larcombe
comment: Only using an app due to my Polar M400 capping out (USB port broke) & self control kicking in so not going to use a CC to replace it. Seriously why would you carry around a phone (music?) when you could use a GPS watch instead? In terms of functionality the Polar watch I will get is streets ahead of this app even if I was prepared to pay for the Premium version. Final analysis - looking forward to uninstalling this app ASAP.

author: Jessica Vieira
comment: No signal means no steps counter, no mileage tracking, only to tell me total time and calories burned.

I think this app works great. I love that it tells you while you're running how many miles you've already completed. And it also tells you your pace. When you're finished running you can look at the app see each Pace mile. Great working app and I do suggest the premium. Its worth it. I use this app during my first half marathon Race.
I,m not rating 4.5 its 4.59998* tho I'm motivated w all things in mgife far from purrrfict, when I run using this app it's just joy.

author: Kenneth Rizzo Naudi
comment: When will you bother to fix the training plans bug that i reported over a month ago?! Made the app close to useless to me and regretting going premium! Huge pity!!!

author: Keith O'Rourke
comment: Too many add, constantly popping up , not very accurate on distance ran either, did same run and it gave .2 of a km difference, not impressed at all.

reply.author: Runtastic
reply.content: We're here to serve you & assure you that we don't display ads in our paid products. However, in free products, we do display ads from selected partners as a way to support our business. If you'd prefer an ad-free experience, consider trying Runtastic PRO or becoming a Runtastic Premium Member. We'd love to welcome you to the club!

comment: Locked out of app, data gone. Excruciatingly slow on older phones. Can't change email address once signed up. Terrible experience.

author: chaithanya2706
comment: It says GPS signal lost, in the middle of the run, and then I've to restart the app for it to function, frustrating. You can't track with this....

reply.author: Runtastic
reply.content: Hey there, have you already submitted your problem to our Support Team? If not, please submit a ticket to us at help.runtastic.com. We look forward to helping you resolve this issue. Thank you and have a great day! Your Runtastic Team.

author: Billy Wilson
comment: Forced to download this to transfer my data because of Micoach's demise. It doesn't hold a candle to it unfortunately. Very disappointing

author: 01durianpie
comment: The gps tracking is so bad it has totally stopped these days.

reply.author: Runtastic
reply.content: Hey there, have you already submitted your problem to our Support Team? If not, please submit a ticket to us at help.runtastic.com. We look forward to helping you resolve this issue.

author: Yasmany Zapata Perez
comment: Esta es una de las mejores aplicaciones que he visto y de un sistema para utilizar a diario. Me encanta. La uso desde el 2015. Desgraciadamente nunca podré tener ni un watch de ellos ni una cuenta pro pq mi salario no me lo permite, pero soy amante de Runtastic. Gracias.

author: Carole Liddell
comment: I personally really loved the Story Running feature. It is one of a kind and I just simply wish that there were more stories! I love this app and I hope that the creators of it are still investing in this.

author: Ihlas Kairgeldy
comment: Could not sign in, tried to enter by Facebook, Google and then just sign up, but the qpp wd just freeze and does not go to next page.. uninstalled it.

reply.author: Runtastic
reply.content: Hey there, have you already submitted your problem to our Support Team? If not, please submit a ticket to us at help.runtastic.com. We look forward to helping you resolve this issue.

author: Kanhu Achary
comment: I m using this app since sometime .. it was working fine.but from last couple of cycling's it's not showing the km/distance covered.... though it is showing the time/duration

author: A Google User
comment: Lowered rating from 5 to 2 stars after it started randomly spamming notifications.
